At the 2009 G-20 summit in Pittsburgh, Google chief executive Eric Schmidt suggested that multiplayer games could provide positive opportunities for improving business training and enhancing workplace collaboration. Speaking at a forum session, Eric Schmidt said: The game world is good training for a career in tech. It teaches players to build a network, to use interactive skills and thinking. Everything in the future online is going to look like a multiplayer game. If I were 15 years old, that's what I would be doing right now. Games appeal to people's natural competitive instinct, creating a sense of frustration and reward that increases engagement with the task at hand. by the data from the three newer large rail metropolitan areas( see the section "Rail and Traffic Congestion" above). Congestion Cost Savings. The conclusion of "Washington's War" was that work-trip travel times are longer and traffic congestion is more intense in the large-rail metropolitan areas than in the 43 metropolitan areas without intense rail systems. The costs of lost time( including longer travel times due to congestion and the excess time of transit travel) are thus higher in large-rail metropolitan areas. Further, these longer travel times retard economic and employment growth and result in higher rates of unemployment for lower-income households. ( Emphasis added.)
